DataElement.preferredName: Patient Risk Pathological Staging Eligibility Determination Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the coded value used to classify patients into risk groups by pathologic stage as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Risk Pathological Staging Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the risk assessment criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services based on pathologic stage (the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination of one or more pathology specimens).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia):An examination that is performed to determine the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination of one or more pathology specimens.  Pathologic staging uses evidence acquired during the process of clinical staging, supplemented by histopathologic examination of surgical specimens.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

An examination that is performed to determine the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination of one or more pathology specimens. Pathologic staging uses evidence acquired during the process of clinical staging, supplemented by histopathologic examination of surgical specimens.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the coded value used to classify patients into risk groups as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
